confound:
使迷惑 
to surprise and confuse (someone or something)
appease:
安抚，平息 
to make (someone) pleased or less angry by giving or saying something desired
verdict:
结论，裁定 
the decision made by a jury in a trial
filth:
污物 
a large and very unpleasant amount of dirt
stimulant:
兴奋剂；引起兴奋的药物 
something (such as a drug) that makes you more active or gives you more energy 
110
feeble:
虚弱的，衰弱的 
very weak
distinction:
区别，不同 
a difference that you can see, hear, smell, feel, etc.; a noticeable difference between things 
or people
hinder:
阻碍 
to make (something, such as a task or action) slow or difficult
enticing:
迷人的，具有诱惑力的 
attractive or tempting; alluring
mystique:
神秘 
a special quality that makes a person or thing interesting or exciting
dread:
非常害怕；极为担心 
to be very afraid of something; to fear that something bad is going to happen

恐惧；令人惧怕的事物 
a feeling of great fear about something that might or will happen in the future; a thing that 
causes this feeling
forthright:
直率的 
honest and direct; providing answers or information in a very clear and direct way
fictitious:
虚构的 
conventionally or hypothetically assumed or accepted
negate:
取消；使无效 
to cause (something) to not be effective
repeal:
废除，撤销 
to officially make (a law) no longer valid
downturn:
商业经济的衰退，下降，衰退期 
a fall in the amount of business that is done; a time when the economy becomes weaker
writhe:
通常指由于剧痛或不适而扭动，翻滚 
to twist your body from side to side
erudite:
博学的 
having or showing knowledge that is learned by studying
succinct:
简洁的 
using few words to state or express an idea 
111 
from scratch 从零开始的；白手起家的 
from the very beginning, especially without utilizing or relying on any previous work for assistance
incredulous:
怀疑的，不肯相信的 
not able or willing to believe something; feeling or showing a lack of belief
levy:
征收额； 尤指税款 
an extra amount of money that has to be paid, especially as a tax to the government

征收；征 税 
to use official authority to demand and collect a payment, tax, etc.
reactionary:
反动的；保守的 
a person who is strongly opposed to new political or social ideas
humanoid:
人形机器人；类人的动物；人猿 
a machine or creature that looks and behaves like a human being
hasten:
赶紧做某事 
to cause (something) to happen more quickly
nuance:
细微差别 
a very small difference in color, tone, meaning, etc.
delineate:
勾画 
to clearly show or describe (something)
truncate:
截短的 
to shorten by cutting off a part, end, or top
expound:
解释 
to explain or state (something); to give details about (something)
rein:
控制 
to limit or control (someone or something)

缰绳 
a strap that is fastened to a device (called a bridle) placed on the head of an animal (such as 
a horse) and that is used to guide and control the animal
defiant:
挑衅的，蔑视的 
refusing to obey something or someone; full of defiance 
112
juvenile:
少年的；未成年的 
connected with young people who are not yet adults

幼稚的；不成熟的；孩子气的 
silly and more typical of a child than an adult

少年 
a young person who is not yet an adult
lethargy:
无精打采；没有热情；冷漠 
the state of not having any energy or enthusiasm for doing things
dissonance:
不和谐，不一致 
not in harmony
altar:
圣坛 a raised place on which sacrifices and gifts are offered in some religions — sometimes 
used figuratively
capacious:
宽敞的 
able to hold or contain a lot; large in capacity
rueful:
悲伤的 
showing or feeling regret for something done 
stave off 推迟；暂时避开 
to keep (someone or something) away usually for a short time
hapless:
不幸的 
having no luck; very unfortunate
pedestrian:
行人；步行者 
a person walking in the street and not travelling in a vehicle

普通的，平淡无奇的；乏味的 
ordinary, lacking inspiration or excitement; dull
recollect:
记起；回忆起；记得 
to remember something, especially by making an effort to remember it
deception:
欺骗；蒙骗；诓骗 
the act of deliberately making somebody believe something that is not true

诡计；骗术；骗局 
a trick intended to make somebody believe something that is not true
instill:
慢慢滴入 
to cause to enter drop by drop

逐渐灌输 
to gradually cause someone to have (an attitude, feeling, etc.) 
113
uncluttered:
简洁的；整洁的；利落的 
not containing too many objects, details or unnecessary items
obscene:
可憎的，可恶的，道德败坏的 
very offensive in usually a shocking way; morally disturbing or upsetting

淫秽的，下流的 
relating to sex in an indecent or offensive way
disposition:
倾向 
a tendency to act or think in a particular way

性情 
the usual attitude or mood of a person or animal
mob:
暴民，暴徒 
a large group or crowd of people who are angry or violent or difficult to control
physiological:
生理的 
characteristic of or appropriate to an organism's healthy or normal functioning
underpin:
巩固 
to strengthen or support (something) from below
metabolism:
新陈代谢 
the chemical processes by which a plant or an animal uses food, water, etc., to grow and 
heal and to make energy
eerie:
怪异的；神秘的；令人恐怖的 
strange, mysterious and frightening
ascertain:
确定，查明，弄清 
to find out or learn with certainty
menace:
威胁，危险人物，祸害 
a dangerous or possibly harmful person or thing

威胁，恐吓 
to threaten harm to (someone or something)
repugnant:
让人反感的；令人厌恶的 
causing a strong feeling of dislike or disgust
tamper(with):
用不正当手段干预，篡改 
to change or touch (something) especially in a way that causes damage or harm
appendage:
附属物 
something connected or joined to a larger or more important thing 
114
patronize:
赞助，资助，光顾 
to give money or support to (someone or something)

屈尊对待，对 摆出屈尊俯就的样子 
to talk to (someone) in a way that shows that you believe you are more intelligent or better 
than other people
magnanimous:
慷慨的，宽宏大量的 
having or showing a generous and kind nature
weep:
通常因悲伤哭泣，流泪 
to cry, usually because you are sad

伤口 流出，渗出液体 
(of a wound)to produce liquid

哭泣；落泪 
an act of crying
immobilize:
使不动；使固定 
to keep (something or someone) from moving or working; to make (something or 
someone) immobile
sketch:
画素描 
to make a quick, rough drawing of (something)

素描 
a quick, rough drawing that shows the main features of an object or scene
deplete:
耗尽 
to use most or all of (something important)
tranquility:
安静 
the quality or state of being tranquil
colloquial:
口语的，会话的 
used when people are speaking in an informal way
tarnish:
玷污 
to become or cause (metal) to become dull and not shiny

a thin layer on the surface of metal which makes the metal look dull
disdainful:
轻视的；鄙视的；倨傲的 
showing disdain
overshadow:

使黯然失色 
to cause (something or someone) to seem less important or impressive when compared to

oblige:
以法律、义务等强迫，迫使 
to force somebody to do something, by law, because it is a duty, etc.

根据要求或需要帮忙，效劳

sober:
清醒的，没喝醉的 
not drunk

严肃的 
having or showing a very serious attitude or quality
deterrent:
威慑的，制止的 
serving to discourage, prevent, or inhibit
cult:
狂热崇拜

blush:

transact:
交易 
to do (business) with another person, company, etc.
subscription:

会员费；订阅费

勤奋的

omniscient:
无所不知的

fecundity:
繁殖力

imposing:
给人印象深刻的，壮观的

allure:

诱惑力

sanguine:
乐观的，自信的 
confident and hopeful

pristine:
原始的 
not changed by people; left in its natural state

崭新的 
in perfect condition; completely clean, fresh, neat, etc.
engross: 吸引，使全神贯注 to hold the complete interest or attention of (someone) — usually used as (be/get) engrossed
